segments.text: I see a woman drying dishes with such focus, completely unaware of the chaos around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The sink is overflowing, water spilling everywhere, and she doesn’t even notice.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: Her foot is in a puddle, but she just keeps polishing that plate like nothing’s wrong.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I wonder if she’s just too tired to care or if she’s in some kind of trance.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The children behind her are up to no good, but she’s totally oblivious.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I can’t believe how calm she looks while everything is falling apart.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The water is going to ruin the cabinets, and she’s just standing there.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think she needs to wake up and pay attention before something bad happens.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The contrast between her and the kids is almost funny, but it’s also kind of tragic.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope someone snaps her out of it soon.
segments.speaker: PAR
